s3025-118:
To amend the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 to repeal restrictions on onshore wind and solar.

Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,

Section 1. Short title

This Act may be cited as the “Repeal of Restrictions on Onshore Wind and Solar Act of 2023”.

Sec. 2. Findings

Congress finds the following:

(1) The United States has a long history of using wind and solar energy to generate electricity.

(2) Wind and solar energy are clean, renewable sources of energy that do not produce greenhouse gases.

(3) The development of wind and solar energy has been hampered by restrictions on the construction of onshore wind and solar projects.

(4) These restrictions have made it more difficult for the United States to achieve its climate goals.

(5) Repealing the restrictions on onshore wind and solar projects would help the United States to reduce its reliance on fossil fuels and to combat climate change.

Sec. 3. Repeal of restrictions on onshore wind and solar

(a) In general

Section 135 of the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 (15 U.S.C. 7175) is amended by striking subsection (b).

(b) Conforming amendment

The table of contents of the Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 is amended by striking the item relating to section 135(b).

Sec. 4. Authorization of appropriations

There are authorized to be appropriated such sums as may be necessary to carry out this Act.

To require assessments of opportunities to install and maintain floating photovoltaic solar panels at Bureau of Reclamation and Corps of Engineers projects, and for other purposes.

The purpose of this bill is to require the Bureau of Reclamation and the Corps of Engineers to conduct assessments of the opportunities to install and maintain floating photovoltaic solar panels at their projects.

Floating photovoltaic solar panels are a relatively new technology that has the potential to generate significant amounts of clean energy. They are installed on bodies of water, such as lakes and reservoirs, and they float on the surface of the water. This allows them to take advantage of the natural cooling properties of water, which can help to improve their efficiency.

Floating photovoltaic solar panels can be installed at a variety of Bureau of Reclamation and Corps of Engineers projects. These projects include dams, reservoirs, and canals. The assessments required by this bill will help to determine the feasibility of installing floating photovoltaic solar panels at these projects.

The assessments will also consider the environmental impacts of installing floating photovoltaic solar panels. These impacts include the potential for water quality impacts, as well as the potential for impacts on fish and wildlife.

The results of the assessments will be used to inform the Bureau of Reclamation and the Corps of Engineers on the potential for installing floating photovoltaic solar panels at their projects. The assessments will also help to identify the best locations for installing these panels.

This bill is an important step in the development of floating photovoltaic solar panels. These panels have the potential to generate significant amounts of clean energy, and they can be installed at a variety of Bureau of Reclamation and Corps of Engineers projects. The assessments required by this bill will help to determine the feasibility of installing floating photovoltaic solar panels at these projects, and they will also help to identify the best locations for installing these panels.

The Solar Manufacturing Act of 2023 would help to address these problems by providing grants and loans to support and expand the domestic solar component manufacturing supply chain. This funding would help American companies to invest in new manufacturing facilities and equipment, and it would create jobs in the solar industry.

In addition to creating jobs and boosting economic growth, the Solar Manufacturing Act of 2023 would also help us reduce our reliance on foreign sources of energy. By increasing the production of solar panels in the United States, we would be able to generate more of our own clean energy. This would help us to reduce our dependence on fossil fuels and to combat climate change.

I urge you to support the Solar Manufacturing Act of 2023. This bill would be a major step forward in the development of the American solar industry and would help us to achieve our clean energy goals.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
